officialTitle: Comparative Low and High Dose of Dexmedethomidine Can Stabilize Hemodynamics and Blood Loss in Pituitary Tumor Removal by Transphenoid Approach
inclusionCriteria:
1. Age18-65
2. ASA 1-2
3. Elective TNTS resection of Pituitary Tumor
4. No narcotic before surgery as premedication
5. Able to Extubate
* Must have minimum age of 18 Years
* Must have maximum age of 65 Years
exclusionCriteria:
1. GCS less than 15
2. Preoperative Heart Rate less than 50 beat/min
3. No Beta-Blockers
4. Pregnant patients
5. Take any Alpha-Methyldopa, Clonodine, Other Alpha-2 Adrenergic Agonist
6. Hemodynamic unstable
7. Systolic BP more than 160mmHg
8. CAD
9. Renal insuffuciency
10. Allergy in dexmedethomidine and opioid
11. BMI more than 30
12. Denied consent
